trans-unit.source: Configures the ASP.NET event-buffering settings for event providers.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> class is used to define roles for event providers, such as Critical, Notification, Analysis, and Logging.
Each role would buffer events differently, as appropriate for that role.

For example a Critical role would keep the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxBufferSize%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxFlushSize%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.UrgentFlushInterval%2A> properties small, whereas an Analysis role would set those properties to higher values.
This class corresponds to the `bufferModes` configuration-file element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings"></xref> class using specified settings.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings"></xref> object being created.
The maximum number of events buffered at one time.
The value must be greater than zero.
The maximum number of events per buffer flush.
Must be greater than zero.
The number of events buffered before a buffer flush is triggered.
The value must be greater than zero and less than or equal to maxBufferSize.
The standard amount of time between buffer flushes.
The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref href="System.Int32.MaxValue"></xref> ticks.
The minimum length of time that can pass between buffer flushes.
The value must be less than or equal to regularFlushInterval.
The maximum number of buffer-flushing threads that can be active at one time.
Gets or sets the maximum number of events that can be buffered at one time.
This property must have a value greater than zero.
Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.
The maximum number of events that can be buffered at one time.
Gets or sets the maximum number of flushing threads that can be active at one time.
This property must have a value greater than zero.
Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
The maximum number of flushing threads that can be active at one time.
The default is 1.
Gets or sets the maximum number of events per flush.
This property must have a value greater than zero.
Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.
The maximum number of events per flush.
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings"></xref> object.
A unique name is required.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings"></xref> object.
The default value is an empty string.
Gets or sets the amount of time between buffer flushes.
This property must have a value greater than zero.
The value can be made infinite by setting it to <xref:System.Int32.MaxValue> ticks.
Invalid values may cause an exception when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.
The regular amount of time between buffer flushes.
Gets or sets the minimum amount of time that can pass between buffer flushes.
This property must have a value greater than zero and less than or equal to the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.RegularFlushInterval%2A> property.
Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.
The minimum amount of time that can pass between buffer flushes.
Gets or sets the number of events that can be buffered before a flush is triggered.
This property must have a value greater than zero and less than or equal to the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings.MaxBufferSize%2A> property.
Invalid values may cause an exception when the configuration section is saved.
The default value varies based on the provider.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BufferModeSettings> objects in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.BufferModes%2A> collection are referred to by name by the providers in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HealthMonitoringSection.Providers%2A> collection.
The number of events that can be buffered before a flush is triggered.
